name: Honey Dijon Roasted Carrot Bake
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Lightly grease a 9x16-inch baking dish.
In a large bowl, whisk together olive oil, Dijon mustard, honey, apple cider vinegar, smoked paprika (if using), salt, and pepper until smooth.
Add sliced carrots and toss well to coat evenly in the glaze.
Spread glazed carrots evenly into the prepared baking dish.
Cover tightly with foil and bake for 25 minutes.
Meanwhile, toast the chopped nuts in a dry skillet over medium heat for 3–5 minutes, stirring often, until fragrant and lightly golden. Set aside.
Remove the foil from the carrots. Sprinkle toasted nuts evenly over the top.
Return dish to the oven and bake uncovered for an additional 10–15 minutes, until the carrots are tender and slightly caramelized.
Let cool for 5 minutes, then sprinkle with fresh chopped parsley before serving.

storage_tips.room_temp: Hold at room temperature for up to 2 hours before serving if needed. Reheat gently if desired.
storage_tips.refrigeration: Store leftovers covered in the fridge for up to 3 days. Reheat covered at 325°F until warmed through.

optional: small offset spatula (to help spread carrots evenly)
